original_title: Corral Some Zippy Blue Flames Into 3D Printed Troughs
original_content:
[Steve Mould] came across an interesting little phenomenon of blue flames zipping around a circular track. This led to diving down a bit of a rabbit hole about excitable mediums, ultimately leading him to optimize the shapes and come up with some pretty wild variations which he shows off in a video (also embedded below.)
After figuring out that the moving flame depended on combustion of fuel vapor in an environment that didnt allow for the whole surface to stay lit at once, [Steve] tried to optimize the design of 3d-printed channels and raceways to encourage this effect, and he came up with some pretty novel ones. The 3D models are here if youd like to try them for yourself (we especially like the figure eight and rays models.)
The video is an excellent show  tell of everything [Steve] dove into, complete with plenty of demonstrations of harnessing this effect to create some nifty running flames. Check it out in the video below, and if unintuitive physical effects are your thing, dont miss [Steve]s peeling apart of the turntable paradox.
title: 青い炎の動きを最適化：驚くべき効果を引き出す3Dモデルの作成
body: 【Steve Mould】は、青い炎が円形のトラックを疾走する興味深い現象を発見し、燃料蒸気の燃焼に依存する動く炎の最適化を試みました。彼は3Dモデルを作成し、効果的なランニングフレームを示しています。ビデオでデモをお楽しみください。
titles: 青い炎の動きを最適化：驚くべき効果を引き出す3Dモデルの作成
自作可能：3Dプリントされたチャネルを使ったランニングフレームの製作方法
高効率なデザイン：燃料蒸気を使用した動く炎の最適化手法
面白い物理効果とは：スティーブ・モールド氏のターンテーブルのパラドックス解説
レーストラックのような3Dプリント囲い：驚くべき効果を示す映像の紹介
